chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
Y: Type
X: Type
eq_X_dec: eqdec X
x: X
l: list (X * Y)

Goal:
match list_assoc x l with | Some y => In (x, y) l | None => ~ In x (map fst l) end

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
In : forall A : Type, A -> list A -> Prop
list_assoc = fix list_assoc (x : X) (l : list (X * Y)) {struct l} : option Y := match l with | nil => None | (y, a) :: l0 => if eq_X_dec x y then Some a else list_assoc x l0 end : X -> list (X * Y) -> option Y Arguments list_assoc _ _%list_scope
map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> list A -> list B
Inductive option (A : Type) : Type := Some : A -> option A | None : option A Arguments option _%type_scope Arguments Some {A}%type_scope a : rename Arguments None {A}%type_scope
eqdec = fun X : Type => forall x y : X, {x = y} + {x <> y} : Type -> Type Arguments eqdec _%type_scope
fst = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (x, _) := p in x : forall A B : Type, A * B -> A Arguments fst {A B}%type_scope
ZMicromega.ZChecker = fix ZChecker (l : list (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z)) (pf : ZMicromega.ZArithProof) {struct pf} : bool := match pf with | ZMicromega.DoneProof => false | ZMicromega.RatProof w pf0 => match ZMicromega.eval_Psatz l w with | Some f => if ZMicromega.Zunsat f then true else ZChecker (f :: l) pf0 | None => false end | ZMicromega.CutProof w pf0 => match ZMicromega.eval_Psatz l w with | Some f => match ZMicromega.genCuttingPlane f with | Some cp => ZChecker (ZMicromega.nformula_of_cutting_plane cp :: l) pf0 | None => true end | None => false end | ZMicromega.EnumProof w1 w2 pf0 => match ZMicromega.eval_Psatz l w1 with | Some f1 =>...
map_ext_in_iff : map ?f ?l = map ?g ?l < -> (forall a : ?A, In a ?l -> ?f a = ?g a) where ?A : [X : Type Y : Type eq_X_dec : eqdec X x : X l : list (X * Y) |- Type] ?B : [X : Type Y : Type eq_X_dec : eqdec X x : X l : list (X * Y) |- Type] ?f : [X : Type Y : Type eq_X_dec : eqdec X x : X l : list (X * Y) |- ?A -> ?B] ?g : [X : Type Y : Type eq_X_dec : eqdec X x : X l : list (X * Y) |- ?A -> ?B] ?l : [X : Type Y : Type eq_X_dec : eqdec X x : X l : list (X * Y) |- list ?A]
in_prod_aux : forall (A B : Type) (x : A) (y : B) (l : list B), In y l -> In (x, y) (map (fun y0 : B => (x, y0)) l)
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => y | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
list_assoc_eq : forall (x : X) (y : Y) (l : list (X * Y)) (x' : X), x = x' -> list_assoc x' ((x, y) :: l) = Some y
BinPosDef.Pos.add = with add (x y : BinNums.positive) {struct x} : BinNums.positive := match x with | BinNums.xI p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xO (add_carry p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xI (add p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xO (BinPosDef.Pos.succ p) end | BinNums.xO p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xI (add p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xO (add p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xI p end | BinNums.xH => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xO (BinPosDef.Pos.succ q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xI q | BinNums.x...
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub = fix pos_sub (x y : BinNums.positive) {struct y} : BinNums.Z := match x with | BinNums.xI p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinIntDef.Z.double (pos_sub p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinIntDef.Z.succ_double (pos_sub p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xO p) end | BinNums.xO p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinIntDef.Z.pred_double (pos_sub p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinIntDef.Z.double (pos_sub p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.pred_double p) end | BinNums.xH => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.Zneg (BinNums.xO q) | BinNums.xO q =>...
list_assoc_neq : forall (x : X) (y : Y) (l : list (X * Y)) (x' : X), x <> x' -> list_assoc x' ((x, y) :: l) = list_assoc x' l
notin_flat_map_Forall : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> list B) (x : B) (l : list A), ~ In x (flat_map f l) < -> Forall (fun y : A => ~ In x (f y)) l
in_prod : forall (A B : Type) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (x : A) (y : B), In x l -> In y l' -> In (x, y) (list_prod l l')
in_prod_iff : forall (A B : Type) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (x : A) (y : B), In (x, y) (list_prod l l') < -> In x l /\ In y l'
map_cst_snoc : forall (X Y : Type) (y : Y) (ll : list X) (mm : list Y), y :: map (fun _ : X => y) ll ++ mm = map (fun _ : X => y) ll ++ y :: mm
flat_map_single : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (l : list X), flat_map (fun x : X => f x :: nil) l = map f l
in_combine_l : forall (A B : Type) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (x : A) (y : B), In (x, y) (combine l l') -> In x l
list_injective_rect : forall (X : Type) (P : list X -> Type), P nil -> (forall (x : X) (l : list X), ~ In x l -> P l -> P (x :: l)) -> forall l : list X, list_injective l -> P l
BinPosDef.Pos.succ = fix succ (x : BinNums.positive) : BinNums.positive := match x with | BinNums.xI p => BinNums.xO (succ p) | BinNums.xO p => BinNums.xI p | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xO BinNums.xH end : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.succ _%positive_scope
BinPosDef.Pos.pred_double = fix pred_double (x : BinNums.positive) : BinNums.positive := match x with | BinNums.xI p => BinNums.xI (BinNums.xO p) | BinNums.xO p => BinNums.xI (pred_double p) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xH end : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.pred_double _%positive_scope
in_flat_map_Exists : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> list B) (x : B) (l : list A), In x (flat_map f l) < -> Exists (fun y : A => In x (f y)) l
not_in_cons : forall (A : Type) (x a : A) (l : list A), ~ In x (a :: l) < -> x <> a /\ ~ In x l
in_combine_r : forall (A B : Type) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (x : A) (y : B), In (x, y) (combine l l') -> In y l'
in_map_iff : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (y : B), In y (map f l) < -> (exists x : A, f x = y /\ In x l)
String.string_of_list_ascii = fix string_of_list_ascii (s : list Ascii.ascii) : String.string := match s with | nil => String.EmptyString | ch :: s0 => String.String ch (string_of_list_ascii s0) end : list Ascii.ascii -> String.string Arguments String.string_of_list_ascii _%list_scope
measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, m y < m x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
list_fun_inv : forall (X : Type) (l : list X), X -> {f : nat -> X | l = map f (list_an 0 (length l))}
BinPosDef.Pos.max = fun p p' : BinNums.positive => match BinPosDef.Pos.compare p p' with | Gt => p | _ => p' end : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.max (_ _)%positive_scope
Ring_polynom.mkZmon = fun (j : BinNums.positive) (M : Ring_polynom.Mon) => match M with | Ring_polynom.mon0 => Ring_polynom.mon0 | _ => Ring_polynom.zmon j M end : BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Mon Arguments Ring_polynom.mkZmon _%positive_scope
list_an = fix list_an (a n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => a :: list_an (S a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments list_an (_ _)%nat_scope
in_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (x : A), In x l -> In (f x) (map f l)
NoDup_cons : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l : list A), ~ In x l -> NoDup l -> NoDup (x :: l)
